channel.title: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here
channel.description:
no this is not thread about what bands u listen to ,its about how u first got into metal and rock'n Roll music in general ,I'll start
I was 5 when I first heard this music ,back in 1995 my older brother brought these Cassettes & CDs of Metallica ,Slayer and Nirvana , I remember the first songs I ever heard were Nothing else matters by Metallica ,Raining blood by slayer and Come as you are by Nirvana
what about you ?

item.title: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here
item.dc:creator: Dr_Perky
item.description:
I used to only listen to classic rock stuff like Queen, AC/DC, Pink Floyd.
Then one day I heard Chiodos and gave harder heavier music a chance.
Then I realized the heavy music was too stagnant all it was to me was lots of low notes and fast strumming. At this point I discovered Indie Rock and Dance Rock and now my musical tastes range in almost every genre except country music. Some of my current favourites are

Foxy Shazam
Black Kids
The Cure
Vampire Weekend
Miike Snow
Passion Pit
Mystery Jets
Genghis Tron
Between the Buried and Me
Rick Wakeman
Arcade Fire
Architecture in Helsinki
Crime in Choir
Death From Above 1979
MGMT
Ra Ra Riot
HORSE the Band
Gregory & the Hawk

Read full topic

I can’t believe I actually made that list though, no one cares and no-one’s going to read it.

item.source: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here

item.title: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
I grew up to my father’s favorites, Billy Joel, Simon and Garfunkel, Pink Floyd, Meat Loaf and stuff. Then as I got my own radio I started listening to regular 80s rock bands and moved into hair bands. Then one weekend when I was 14 I heard a lot of Anthrax and Metallica. I started trying to find more and more heavy music after that. I went on to Slayer, then Morbid Angel, Morgoth, Carcass, and Sepultura.

Now, I am so steeped in heavy metal it’s almost all that I listen to. Sure, I have a few rock CDs laying about. Chevelle (playing now), Skindred, Hurt, A Perfect Circle, Butthole Surfers, nine Inch Nails, Disturbed, and Living Colour, but most of what I listen to mixed metal.
36 Crazy fists
The Acacia Strain
All That remains
Amon Amarth
Amorphis
Ankla
Arch Enemy (right now)
At the Gates
Between the Buried and Me
The Black dahlia Murder
Bleeding Through
Bloodbath
Bolt Thrower
Bury Your Dead
Callenish Circle
Cavalera Conspiracy
Children of Bodom
Chimaira
Cyanotic
Daath
Darkane
Dead Horse
Deicide
Demon Hunter
Dethklok
DevilDriver
Devin Townsend (SYL, Ocean Machine, Physicist)
Diecast
The Dillinger Escape Plan
Droid
Dry Kill Logic
E Town Concrete
Entombed
The Faceless
Fear Factory
Glassjaw
God Forbid
Gojira
Gorguts
Grave
Grip Inc.
Hate Eternal
The Haunted
In Flames
Indorphine
iwrestledabearonce
Kilgore
Killswitch Engage
Lockedown (local band, now defunct)
Lykathea Aflame
Machine Head
Mastodon
Megadeth
Meashuggah (now playing)
Mors Principium Est
Mudvayne
Mushroomhead
Nile
Nothingface
Novembers Doom
Obituary
Pantera
Paradise Lost
Ripping Corpse
Rumpelstiltskin Grinder
Scar Symmetry
Shadows Fall
Six Feet Under
Skinlab
Sky Eats Airplane
Slipknot
Soulfly
Stuck Mojo
Testament
Thine Eyes Bleed
Threat Signal
Three Mile Scream
Trivium (their older stuff, when they screamed and growled)
Unearth
Vampire Mooose
Zimmer’s Hole

And that is just the stuff that I like. There were a few dozen bands that I didn’t mention! And this reply is wrecking havoc with my spellchecker…

item.source: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here

item.title: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
Grunge (sometimes referred to as the Seattle sound) is a subgenre of alternative rock that emerged during the mid-1980s in the American state of Washington, particularly in the Seattle area. Inspired by hardcore punk, heavy metal and indie rock, grunge is generally characterized by heavily distorted electric guitars, contrasting song dynamics, and apathetic or angst-filled lyrics.

Wiki

Read full topic
item.source: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here

item.title: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
To make a very short story, Grunge is a sub-genre of Punk, which is a sub-genre of Metal, which is a sub-genre of Rock. So yeah basically, this thread should be named: Music with a guitar and a drum lovers, gather here.

Read full topic

i only like heavy metal bands leik blink 182 and linkin park

haha lol

Mine:

  • Queen
  • Nirvana
  • U2
  • AC/DC
  • Led Zeppelin
  • Limp Bizkit (fuck yeah, waiting for Gold Cobra release)
  • NIN
  • MM
  • (rarely) Metallica
  • (very rarely) Pink Floyd

Generally, for headbangin’ I prefer some Electro House to your stupid heavy metal.

grunge is a part of rock

item.title: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Steppenwolf:

I grew up listening to Alice Cooper, AC/DC, Black Sabbath, Queen, etc.
When I was 12, I was totally fascinated by KoRn, but about 1-2 years later I abandoned Nu Metal and turned to Death and Thrash Metal.

A little summary:

Dark Tranquillity
In Flames
Soilwork
At The Gates
Scar Symmetry
Nightrage
Metallica
DevilDriver
Macbeth
Amon Amarth
Arch Enemy
Hypocrisy
Bloodbath
Kataklysm
Machine Head
The Haunted

Nice list.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal & Rock'n roll lovers , gather here
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Yep, love metal. I also love classical, jazz and acoustic stuff.

Few favorites.

  • Devin Townsend
  • All Shall Perish
  • Black Dahlia Murder
  • Buckethead
  • Children Of Bodom
  • The Faceless
  • Gojira
  • Heaven Shall Burn
  • In Flames
  • Led Zeppelin
  • Megadeth
  • Metallica
  • Machine Head
  • Necrophagist
  • Opeth
  • Strapping Young Lad
  • Trivium

I tried to keep it small but it just kept going, a select few anyway. Been listening to Metallica and such for about 6 years now.
